name: Chipotle Cinnamon Picadillo
description: If you're familiar with our Mexican Picadillo from a couple weeks ago then you're going to love this version!  It adds a fiery dose of chipotle cinnamon flavor to create a unique, savory batch of home-cooked Picadillo.  So good!

recipeInstructions.text: After rinsing the tomatoes and cutting out the stems, roast them in a 400F oven for 20-25 minutes or until you need them.
recipeInstructions.name: After rinsing the tomatoes and cutting out the stems, roast them in a 400F oven for 20-25 minutes or until you need them.

recipeInstructions.text: Saute 1/4 onion in oil over medium heat for a few minutes.  Add 2 minced garlic cloves and saute briefly.  Add 1 lb. ground beef and 1 teaspoon salt.  Cook over medium heat until the ground beef is lightly browned.
recipeInstructions.name: Saute 1/4 onion in oil over medium heat for a few minutes.  Add 2 minced garlic cloves and saute briefly.  Add 1 lb. ground beef and 1 teaspoon salt.  Cook over medium heat until the ground beef is lightly browned.

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the potato and carrot into smallish pieces (larger pieces will require more simmering time).  Once the beef is lightly browned, add the potato and carrot.  Saute briefly as you gather the additional ingredients.
recipeInstructions.name: Chop the potato and carrot into smallish pieces (larger pieces will require more simmering time).  Once the beef is lightly browned, add the potato and carrot.  Saute briefly as you gather the additional ingredients.

recipeInstructions.text: For the Tomato-Chipotle mixture, add the roasted tomatoes to a blender or food processor along with 3/4 onion, 2 garlic cloves, 5 chipotles, 1 tablespoon adobo sauce, and a pinch of salt.  Combine well. (Here's more info on working with chipotles in adobo.)
recipeInstructions.name: For the Tomato-Chipotle mixture, add the roasted tomatoes to a blender or food processor along with 3/4 onion, 2 garlic cloves, 5 chipotles, 1 tablespoon adobo sauce, and a pinch of salt.  Combine well. (Here's more info on working with chipotles in adobo.)

recipeInstructions.text: Add the Tomato-Chipotle mixture to the beef, along with 1 teaspoon cinnamon, some freshly cracked black pepper, and 1 cup of stock (or water).
recipeInstructions.name: Add the Tomato-Chipotle mixture to the beef, along with 1 teaspoon cinnamon, some freshly cracked black pepper, and 1 cup of stock (or water).

recipeInstructions.text: Combine well and simmer over medium-low heat for 20-25 minutes, or until the potatoes are cooked all the way through.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine well and simmer over medium-low heat for 20-25 minutes, or until the potatoes are cooked all the way through.

recipeInstructions.text: Take a final taste for seasoning.  I added another 1/2 teaspoon of salt and a heaping 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon to this batch.  Serve immediately.
recipeInstructions.name: Take a final taste for seasoning.  I added another 1/2 teaspoon of salt and a heaping 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon to this batch.  Serve immediately.

recipeInstructions.text: If you want to serve your Picadillo with raisins or currants you can add them to the beef mixture for the last few minutes of the simmer or you can simply add them as a final garnish.

recipeInstructions.text: Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge.
